title: ğŸ§  Dopemux - ADHD-Optimized Development Platform
text:
# ğŸ§  Dopemux - ADHD-Optimized Development Platform

> **Dopemux MVP**: Complete ADHD-optimized development platform with health monitoring, MCP server integration, and comprehensive Claude Code support.

Dopemux is a specialized development platform designed for neurodivergent developers, particularly those with ADHD. It provides context preservation, attention monitoring, task decomposition, and comprehensive health monitoring to enhance productivity and reduce cognitive load.

[![Python](https://img.shields.io/badge/Python-3.10+-blue.svg)](https://python.org)
[![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-green.svg)](LICENSE)
[![ADHD](https://img.shields.io/badge/ADHD-Optimized-purple.svg)](docs/ADHD_FEATURES.md)
[![Health](https://img.shields.io/badge/Health-Monitoring-orange.svg)](docs/HEALTH_MONITORING.md)

title: ğŸ¯ Key Features
text: ## ğŸ¯ Key Features

title: **ğŸ§  ADHD-First Design**
text:
### **ğŸ§  ADHD-First Design**
- **Context Preservation**: Automatic session state management across interruptions
- **Attention Monitoring**: Real-time focus state tracking and adaptive responses
- **Task Decomposition**: Complex tasks broken into manageable 25-minute chunks
- **Gentle Guidance**: Non-judgmental, encouraging feedback and clear next steps
- **Decision Reduction**: Maximum 3 options presented to reduce cognitive overwhelm

title: **ğŸ¥ Comprehensive Health Monitoring**
text:
### **ğŸ¥ Comprehensive Health Monitoring**
- **Real-time Health Checks**: Monitor Dopemux core, Claude Code, MCP servers, and system resources
- **Slash Command Integration**: Instant health status from Claude Code with `/health`, `/mcp-status`, `/health-fix`
- **Auto-remediation**: Automatic service restart and problem resolution
- **ADHD-Friendly Interface**: Clear visual indicators (ğŸŸ¢ğŸŸ¡ğŸ”´) and minimal cognitive load
- **Docker MCP Support**: Ready for comprehensive Docker-based MCP server ecosystem

title: **ğŸ”§ Claude Code Integration**
text:
### **ğŸ”§ Claude Code Integration**
- **MCP Server Management**: Integrated sequential thinking and reasoning capabilities
- **Auto-responder**: Intelligent confirmation handling with attention-aware features
- **Configuration Management**: ADHD-optimized Claude Code setup and maintenance
- **Project Templates**: Pre-configured setups for common development scenarios

title: **âš¡ Advanced MCP Ecosystem**
text:
### **âš¡ Advanced MCP Ecosystem**
- **Sequential Thinking Server**: Multi-agent reasoning with DeepSeek/GitHub Models
- **MCP Proxy Integration**: Seamless Docker-to-Claude Code connectivity
- **Leantime Integration**: Project management with ADHD accommodations
- **Docker Orchestration**: Scalable MCP server architecture
- **Health Monitoring**: Comprehensive service monitoring and auto-recovery

title: âœ¨ Features
text: ## âœ¨ Features

title: ğŸ§  ADHD-First Design
text:
### ğŸ§  ADHD-First Design
- **Attention State Management**: Automatic focus duration tracking and break recommendations
- **Cognitive Load Balancing**: Smart task scheduling based on complexity and mental capacity
- **Context Preservation**: Never lose your place with automatic session saves and restoration
- **Executive Function Support**: Clear next steps and decision reduction to minimize overwhelm
- **ADHD Metadata**: Every task includes cognitive load (1-10), focus level, break reminders, and optimal timing
- **Attention-Aware Filtering**: Get tasks by attention level, cognitive capacity, and current state

title: ğŸš€ AI-Powered Workflow
text:
### ğŸš€ AI-Powered Workflow
- **PRD-to-Tasks**: Transform Product Requirements Documents into actionable task breakdowns
- **Intelligent Scheduling**: Optimal task sequencing based on attention patterns and complexity
- **Bidirectional Sync**: Seamless data flow between Leantime project management and Task-Master AI
- **Claude Auto Responder**: Automatic Claude Code confirmation responses with ADHD accommodations
- **Real-time Optimization**: Continuous workflow adaptation based on performance metrics

title: ğŸ³ Self-Hosted Infrastructure
text:
### ğŸ³ Self-Hosted Infrastructure
- **Docker-Based Deployment**: One-command setup with docker-compose
- **Leantime Integration**: Neurodiversity-focused project management platform
- **Task-Master AI**: Advanced PRD parsing and task decomposition via MCP
- **Health Monitoring**: Comprehensive system checks and automated recovery

title: ğŸ¯ Quick Start
text: ## ğŸ¯ Quick Start

title: Prerequisites
text:
### Prerequisites
- Docker & Docker Compose
- Python 3.8+
- Node.js 18+
- 4GB+ RAM (8GB recommended)

title: Installation
text:
### Installation
```bash

title: Clone repository
text:
# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/your-repo/dopemux-mvp.git
cd dopemux-mvp

title: Automated installation (recommended)
text:
# Automated installation (recommended)
python installers/leantime/install.py --interactive

title: Manual installation
text:
# Manual installation
cd docker/leantime
docker-compose up -d

section_path: MCP Proxy Setup for Claude Code Integration
title: MCP Proxy Setup for Claude Code Integration
text:
# MCP Proxy Setup for Claude Code Integration
./scripts/mcp-proxy-setup.sh setup
npm install -g claude-task-master
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

section_path: MCP Proxy Setup for Claude Code Integration
title: First Use
text:
### First Use
1. **Access Leantime**: http://localhost:8080 (admin/admin)
2. **Verify Health**: `python installers/leantime/health_check.py`
3. **Create Project**: Start with a simple PRD document
4. **Enable ADHD Mode**: Configure attention tracking preferences
5. **Test MCP Integration**: Use `/mcp` in Claude Code to access containerized servers

section_path: MCP Proxy Setup for Claude Code Integration
title: ğŸ”— MCP Proxy Integration
text:
### ğŸ”— MCP Proxy Integration

Dopemux includes an innovative MCP proxy solution that bridges Docker-containerized MCP servers with Claude Code:

```bash

title: Quick setup
text:
# Quick setup
./scripts/mcp-proxy-setup.sh setup

title: Verify connection
text:
# Verify connection
claude mcp list  # Should show âœ“ Connected servers

title: Use in Claude Code
text:
# Use in Claude Code
/mcp tools list  # See available MCP tools
```

**Available MCP Servers:**
- **Sequential Thinking** - Advanced multi-agent reasoning
- **Exa Search** - Web research and data gathering
- **Zen Orchestration** - Multi-model coordination
- **Serena Navigation** - Enhanced code exploration

ğŸ“– **Detailed guides:**
- [Quick Start](docs/MCP_PROXY_QUICK_START.md) - Get running in 2 minutes
- [Complete Setup Guide](docs/MCP_PROXY_SETUP_GUIDE.md) - Comprehensive documentation

title: ğŸ”§ Core Components
text: ## ğŸ”§ Core Components

title: Leantime Bridge (`src/integrations/leantime_bridge.py`)
text:
### Leantime Bridge (`src/integrations/leantime_bridge.py`)
- **MCP Client**: Protocol-based integration with Leantime API
- **Project Management**: Create, read, update, delete operations for projects and tasks
- **ADHD Features**: Attention-level filtering, cognitive load assessment, break reminders

title: Task-Master Bridge (`src/integrations/taskmaster_bridge.py`)
text:
### Task-Master Bridge (`src/integrations/taskmaster_bridge.py`)
- **PRD Processing**: Intelligent analysis of Product Requirements Documents
- **Task Decomposition**: Break complex features into manageable chunks
- **Complexity Assessment**: Cognitive load scoring for optimal scheduling

title: Sync Manager (`src/integrations/sync_manager.py`)
text:
### Sync Manager (`src/integrations/sync_manager.py`)
- **Bidirectional Sync**: Real-time data synchronization between systems
- **Conflict Resolution**: Intelligent handling of concurrent updates
- **Event Sourcing**: Complete audit trail of all changes

title: ADHD Optimizations (`src/utils/adhd_optimizations.py`)
text:
### ADHD Optimizations (`src/utils/adhd_optimizations.py`)
- **Attention Tracking**: Monitor focus states and recommend optimal work patterns
- **Context Management**: Preserve mental models across interruptions
- **Schedule Optimization**: Balance cognitive load and task complexity

title: ğŸ“š Documentation
text:
## ğŸ“š Documentation

- **[Installation Guide](docs/INSTALLATION.md)**: Complete setup instructions
- **[User Guide](docs/USER_GUIDE.md)**: ADHD-optimized workflows and features
- **[API Documentation](docs/API.md)**: Complete technical reference

title: ğŸ§ª Testing
text: ## ğŸ§ª Testing

title: Run Test Suite
text:
### Run Test Suite
```bash

title: Full test coverage
text:
# Full test coverage
python -m pytest tests/ --cov=src --cov-report=html

title: Unit tests only
text:
# Unit tests only
python -m pytest tests/unit/ -v

title: Integration tests
text:
# Integration tests
python -m pytest tests/integration/ -v

title: Specific test
text:
# Specific test
python -m pytest tests/unit/test_adhd_optimizations.py -v
```

title: Test Coverage
text:
### Test Coverage
- **Unit Tests**: 100% coverage for all modules
- **Integration Tests**: Complete workflow validation
- **Health Checks**: System monitoring and recovery
- **Performance Tests**: Load testing and optimization

title: ğŸ¨ ADHD-Friendly Features
text: ## ğŸ¨ ADHD-Friendly Features

title: Attention Management
text:
### Attention Management
- **Focus Sessions**: 25-minute blocks with automatic break reminders
- **Attention Detection**: Real-time assessment of cognitive state
- **Context Switching**: Minimal disruption with preserved mental models
- **Progress Visualization**: Clear indicators of completion and remaining work

title: Cognitive Load Optimization
text:
### Cognitive Load Optimization
- **Task Complexity**: 1-10 scoring system for mental effort estimation
- **Schedule Balancing**: Mix of high/medium/low complexity tasks
- **Energy Matching**: Align challenging work with peak attention periods
- **Break Integration**: Regular rest periods built into workflow

title: Executive Function Support
text:
### Executive Function Support
- **Decision Reduction**: Maximum 3 options presented at once
- **Clear Next Steps**: Always know what to do next
- **Prerequisites Tracking**: Dependencies clearly identified
- **Completion Celebration**: Positive reinforcement for task completion

title: ğŸ¤ Contributing
text: ## ğŸ¤ Contributing

title: Development Setup
text:
### Development Setup
```bash

title: Development installation
text:
# Development installation
git clone https://github.com/your-repo/dopemux-mvp.git
cd dopemux-mvp
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # or venv\Scripts\activate on Windows
pip install -e .
pip install -r requirements-dev.txt
```

title: ADHD-Friendly Contributions
text:
### ADHD-Friendly Contributions
- **Any format welcome**: Bullet points, voice notes, rough ideas
- **No judgment**: All questions and suggestions valued
- **Flexible participation**: Contribute when attention allows
- **Clear guidelines**: Specific steps for each contribution type

title: ğŸ“ License
text:

title: ğŸ™ Acknowledgments
text:
## ğŸ™ Acknowledgments

- **Leantime Team**: For creating neurodiversity-focused project management
- **Task-Master AI**: For intelligent task decomposition capabilities
- **ADHD Community**: For insights into attention-friendly development workflows
- **MCP Protocol**: For enabling seamless AI service integration

---

**Built with â¤ï¸ for the ADHD developer community**

*Making development accessible, one focused session at a time.*

title: Dopemux CLI Reference
text: # Dopemux CLI Reference

title: Overview
text:
## Overview

The Dopemux CLI provides ADHD-optimized commands for managing development sessions, context preservation, and task decomposition. All commands are designed with gentle, supportive UX and clear visual feedback.

title: Global Options
text:
## Global Options

```bash
dopemux [GLOBAL_OPTIONS] COMMAND [COMMAND_OPTIONS] [ARGS]
```

title: Global Flags
text:
### Global Flags

| Flag | Description | Example |
|------|-------------|---------|
| `--version` | Show version and exit | `dopemux --version` |
| `--config, -c` | Specify config file path | `dopemux -c custom.yaml start` |
| `--verbose, -v` | Enable verbose output | `dopemux -v status` |

---

title: Commands
text: ## Commands

title: `dopemux init`
text:
### `dopemux init`

**Initialize a Dopemux project with ADHD-optimized configuration**

title: Usage
text:
#### Usage
```bash
dopemux init [DIRECTORY] [OPTIONS]
```

title: Arguments
text:
#### Arguments
- `DIRECTORY` - Target directory (default: current directory)

title: Options
text:
#### Options

| Option | Short | Description | Default | Example |
|--------|-------|-------------|---------|---------|
| `--force` | `-f` | Overwrite existing configuration | `false` | `dopemux init --force` |
| `--template` | `-t` | Project template type | `python` | `dopemux init -t rust` |

title: Available Templates
text:
#### Available Templates

| Template | Description | Generated Config |
|----------|-------------|------------------|
| `python` | Python project with pytest, type hints | PEP 8, Black formatting, mypy |
| `javascript` | Node.js project with modern tooling | ESLint, Prettier, Jest |
| `typescript` | TypeScript project with strict config | TSConfig, type checking |
| `rust` | Rust project with Cargo integration | Clippy, rustfmt, cargo-watch |
| `go` | Go project with modules | gofmt, golint, go test |
| `java` | Java project with Maven/Gradle | Checkstyle, JUnit, SpotBugs |

title: Examples
text:
#### Examples

```bash

section_path: Initialize current directory with Python template
title: Initialize current directory with Python template
text:
# Initialize current directory with Python template
dopemux init

section_path: Initialize specific directory with TypeScript template
title: Initialize specific directory with TypeScript template
text:
# Initialize specific directory with TypeScript template
dopemux init ./my-project --template typescript

title: Force overwrite existing configuration
text:
# Force overwrite existing configuration
dopemux init --force

title: Initialize with Rust template
text:
# Initialize with Rust template
dopemux init ~/code/rust-project -t rust
```

title: What Gets Created
text:
#### What Gets Created

```
project/
â”œâ”€â”€ .dopemux/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ config.yaml          # ADHD profile settings
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ context.db           # SQLite context storage
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ sessions/            # Session backup directory
â””â”€â”€ .claude/
    â”œâ”€â”€ claude.md            # Project-specific Claude instructions
    â”œâ”€â”€ context.md           # Context management configuration
    â”œâ”€â”€ llms.md              # Multi-model AI configuration
    â””â”€â”€ session.md           # Session persistence patterns
```

title: Success Output
text:
#### Success Output
```
ğŸ‰ Project Initialized

ğŸ“ Configuration: /path/to/project/.claude/
ğŸ§  ADHD features: /path/to/project/.dopemux/

Next steps:
â€¢ Run 'dopemux start' to launch Claude Code
â€¢ Use 'dopemux save' to preserve context
â€¢ Check 'dopemux status' for attention metrics
```

title: Error Handling
text:
#### Error Handling

| Error | Solution |
|-------|----------|
| Directory doesn't exist | Create directory or use existing path |
| Already initialized | Use `--force` to overwrite |
| Permission denied | Check write permissions on directory |
| Invalid template | Use `dopemux init --help` to see available templates |

---

title: `dopemux start`
text:
### `dopemux start`

**Launch Claude Code with ADHD optimizations and context restoration**

title: Usage
text:
#### Usage
```bash
dopemux start [OPTIONS]
```

title: Options
text:
#### Options

| Option | Short | Description | Default | Example |
|--------|-------|-------------|---------|---------|
| `--session` | `-s` | Restore specific session ID | Latest session | `dopemux start -s abc123` |
| `--background` | `-b` | Launch in background mode | `false` | `dopemux start --background` |
| `--debug` | | Enable debug output | `false` | `dopemux start --debug` |

title: Examples
text:
#### Examples

```bash

title: Start with latest context
text:
# Start with latest context
dopemux start

title: Restore specific session
text:
# Restore specific session
dopemux start --session abc12345

title: Launch in background
text:
# Launch in background
dopemux start --background

title: Debug mode for troubleshooting
text:
# Debug mode for troubleshooting
dopemux start --debug
```

title: Launch Process
text:
#### Launch Process

1. **ğŸ” Project Check** - Verify Dopemux initialization
2. **ğŸ“ Context Restore** - Load session context (<500ms)
3. **ğŸš€ Claude Launch** - Start Claude Code with MCP servers
4. **ğŸ§  Monitor Start** - Begin attention monitoring
5. **âœ… Ready** - Display session information

title: Output Examples
text:
#### Output Examples

**New Session:**
```
ğŸ†• Starting new session

âœ¨ Claude Code is running with ADHD optimizations
Press Ctrl+C to stop monitoring and save context
```

**Restored Session:**
```
ğŸ“ Welcome back! You were working on: Implement user authentication

ğŸ¯ Goal: Add JWT-based login system
ğŸ“ Files: 5 files restored
â±ï¸  Last save: 2 hours ago
ğŸ§  Attention state: focused

âœ¨ Claude Code is running with ADHD optimizations
Press Ctrl+C to stop monitoring and save context
```

**Background Mode:**
```
ğŸš€ Claude Code launched in background
ğŸ†” Process ID: 12345
ğŸ“‹ Use 'dopemux status' to check session
ğŸ’¾ Context auto-saving every 30 seconds
```

title: Requirements Check
text:
#### Requirements Check

The command will verify:
- âœ… Project is initialized (`.dopemux/` exists)
- âœ… Claude Code is installed and accessible
- âœ… MCP servers are configured
- âœ… SQLite database is accessible

title: Auto-initialization
text:
#### Auto-initialization

If project is not initialized:
```
âš ï¸  Project not initialized. Run 'dopemux init' first.

Initialize now? (y/N): y
```

---

title: `dopemux save`
text:
### `dopemux save`

**Manually save current development context**

title: Usage
text:
#### Usage
```bash
dopemux save [OPTIONS]
```

title: Options
text:
#### Options

| Option | Short | Description | Example |
|--------|-------|-------------|---------|
| `--message` | `-m` | Add save message/note | `dopemux save -m "Before refactoring"` |
| `--force` | `-f` | Force save even if no changes | `dopemux save --force` |

title: Examples
text:
#### Examples

```bash

title: Quick save
text:
# Quick save
dopemux save

title: Save with descriptive message
text:
# Save with descriptive message
dopemux save --message "Completed user model, starting authentication"

title: Force save (useful for testing)
text:
# Force save (useful for testing)
dopemux save --force

title: Save before major change
text:
# Save before major change
dopemux save -m "Before switching to async approach"
```

title: What Gets Saved
text:
#### What Gets Saved

| Context Type | Information Captured |
|--------------|---------------------|
| **File State** | Open files, cursor positions, selections |
| **Mental Model** | Current goal, approach, blockers |
| **Session Data** | Git branch, recent changes, time spent |
| **ADHD Metrics** | Attention state, focus duration, breaks |
| **Decision History** | Choices made, rationale, outcomes |

title: Success Output
text:
#### Success Output
```
âœ… Context saved (session: abc12345)
ğŸ’¾ Captured 7 open files, 3 recent edits
ğŸ§  Attention state: focused (87% focus score)
â±ï¸  Session duration: 23 minutes

Note: Completed user model implementation
```

title: Performance
text:
#### Performance
- âš¡ **Save time:** <50ms (invisible to user)
- ğŸ’¾ **Storage:** ~2-5KB per session
- ğŸ”„ **Auto-save:** Every 30 seconds in background

---

title: `dopemux restore`
text:
### `dopemux restore`

**Restore previous development context**

title: Usage
text:
#### Usage
```bash
dopemux restore [OPTIONS]
```

title: Options
text:
#### Options

| Option | Short | Description | Example |
|--------|-------|-------------|---------|
| `--session` | `-s` | Specific session ID to restore | `dopemux restore -s abc123` |
| `--list` | `-l` | List available sessions | `dopemux restore --list` |

title: Examples
text:
#### Examples

```bash

title: Restore latest session
text:
# Restore latest session
dopemux restore

title: Restore specific session
text:
# Restore specific session
dopemux restore --session abc12345

title: List all available sessions
text:
# List all available sessions
dopemux restore --list

title: List and then restore interactively
text:
# List and then restore interactively
dopemux restore -l

section_path: (shows list, then user can copy session ID)
```
title: `dopemux status`
text:
### `dopemux status`

**Show current session status and ADHD metrics**

section_path: (shows list, then user can copy session ID)
title: Usage
text:
#### Usage
```bash
dopemux status [OPTIONS]
```

section_path: (shows list, then user can copy session ID)
title: Options
text:
#### Options

| Option | Short | Description | Example |
|--------|-------|-------------|---------|
| `--attention` | `-a` | Show only attention metrics | `dopemux status -a` |
| `--context` | `-c` | Show only context information | `dopemux status -c` |
| `--tasks` | `-t` | Show only task progress | `dopemux status -t` |

section_path: (shows list, then user can copy session ID)
title: Examples
text:
#### Examples

```bash

title: Show all status information
text:
# Show all status information
dopemux status

title: Show only attention metrics
text:
# Show only attention metrics
dopemux status --attention

title: Show only context information
text:
# Show only context information
dopemux status --context

title: Show only task progress
text:
# Show only task progress
dopemux status --tasks
```

title: Full Status Output
text:
#### Full Status Output

```bash
dopemux status
```

title: Attention State Indicators
text:
#### Attention State Indicators

| State | Emoji | Description | Recommendation |
|-------|-------|-------------|----------------|
| ğŸ¯ focused | Green | High productivity, low errors | Continue current approach |
| ğŸ˜Š normal | Blue | Balanced work pattern | Standard development pace |
| ğŸŒªï¸ scattered | Yellow | Frequent context switches | Take break or focus on single task |
| ğŸ”¥ hyperfocus | Orange | Very high intensity | Monitor for burnout, suggest breaks |
| ğŸ˜µâ€ğŸ’« distracted | Red | Low focus, high errors | Take break, try grounding exercise |

title: Context Switch Thresholds
text:
#### Context Switch Thresholds

| Count | Status | ADHD Impact |
|-------|--------|-------------|
| 0-5 | ğŸŸ¢ Stable | Focused work session |
| 6-15 | ğŸŸ¡ Moderate | Normal development pattern |
| 16-30 | ğŸŸ  High | Possible scattered attention |
| 31+ | ğŸ”´ Excessive | Likely distraction/overwhelm |

---

title: `dopemux task`
text:
### `dopemux task`

**ADHD-friendly task management with 25-minute chunks**

title: Usage
text:
#### Usage
```bash
dopemux task [DESCRIPTION] [OPTIONS]
dopemux task [OPTIONS]  # When using --list
```

title: Arguments
text:
#### Arguments
- `DESCRIPTION` - Task description (required unless using `--list`)

title: Options
text:
#### Options

| Option | Short | Description | Default | Example |
|--------|-------|-------------|---------|---------|
| `--duration` | `-d` | Task duration in minutes | `25` | `dopemux task "Fix bug" -d 45` |
| `--priority` | `-p` | Priority level | `medium` | `dopemux task "Security fix" -p high` |
| `--list` | `-l` | List current tasks | | `dopemux task --list` |

title: Priority Levels
text:
#### Priority Levels

| Priority | Description | Visual Indicator | Recommended Duration |
|----------|-------------|------------------|---------------------|
| `high` | Critical/blocking work | ğŸ”´ | 25-45 minutes |
| `medium` | Standard development | ğŸŸ¡ | 25 minutes |
| `low` | Nice-to-have features | ğŸŸ¢ | 15-25 minutes |

title: Examples
text:
#### Examples

```bash

section_path: Add new task with default settings (25 min, medium priority)
title: Add new task with default settings (25 min, medium priority)
text:
# Add new task with default settings (25 min, medium priority)
dopemux task "Fix authentication bug"

section_path: Add high-priority task with custom duration
title: Add high-priority task with custom duration
text:
# Add high-priority task with custom duration
dopemux task "Security vulnerability patch" --priority high --duration 45

title: Add low-priority task
text:
# Add low-priority task
dopemux task "Update documentation" -p low -d 15

title: List all current tasks
text:
# List all current tasks
dopemux task --list

title: Quick task addition
text:
# Quick task addition
dopemux task "Refactor user service"
```

title: Task List Output
text:
#### Task List Output

```bash
dopemux task --list
```

```
Current Tasks
```

title: Task Addition Output
text:
#### Task Addition Output

```bash
dopemux task "Implement password reset functionality" --priority medium --duration 30
```

```
âœ… Task added: Implement password reset functionality

ğŸ†” ID: t7a3b2c8
â±ï¸ Duration: 30 minutes
ğŸ¯ Priority: medium
ğŸ“… Status: pending

ğŸ’¡ Tip: This task will be automatically broken into focused segments
ğŸš€ Use 'dopemux start' to begin working with task context
```

title: Automatic Task Decomposition
text:
#### Automatic Task Decomposition

For complex tasks (>45 minutes or high complexity), Dopemux automatically suggests breakdown:

```bash
dopemux task "Build complete user management system" --duration 120
```

```
ğŸ¤” This looks like a complex task! Let me break it down:

ğŸ“‹ Suggested breakdown:
â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ“ Task 1: Design user model schema (25 min)
â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ“ Task 2: Implement user CRUD operations (25 min)
â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ“ Task 3: Add authentication endpoints (25 min)
â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ“ Task 4: Create user management UI (25 min)
â””â”€â”€ ğŸ“ Task 5: Write comprehensive tests (20 min)

âœ… Accept this breakdown? (Y/n): y

ğŸ‰ Created 5 focused tasks totaling 120 minutes
ğŸ¯ Ready to start with: Design user model schema
```

title: Task Status Management
text:
#### Task Status Management

Tasks automatically update status based on session activity:

- â³ **Pending** â†’ ğŸ”„ **In Progress** (when files related to task are opened)
- ğŸ”„ **In Progress** â†’ âœ… **Complete** (when marked complete or time target met)
- Any status â†’ ğŸ“‹ **On Hold** (when blocked or waiting for dependencies)

---

title: `dopemux autoresponder`
text:
### `dopemux autoresponder`

**Manage Claude Auto Responder integration for automatic confirmations**

The autoresponder automatically handles Claude Code confirmation prompts with ADHD-optimized controls and attention-aware features.

title: Usage
text:
#### Usage
```bash
dopemux autoresponder COMMAND [OPTIONS]
```

title: Subcommands
text: #### Subcommands

title: `setup`
text:
##### `setup`
**Download and configure ClaudeAutoResponder tool**

```bash
dopemux autoresponder setup
```

Sets up the ClaudeAutoResponder repository and dependencies. Only needs to be run once per project.

**Example Output:**
```
ğŸ”§ Setting up ClaudeAutoResponder...
âœ… ClaudeAutoResponder setup complete
ğŸš€ Run 'dopemux autoresponder start' to begin
```

title: `start`
text:
##### `start`
**Start automatic confirmation monitoring**

```bash
dopemux autoresponder start [OPTIONS]
```

**Options:**

| Option | Short | Description | Default | Example |
|--------|-------|-------------|---------|---------|
| `--terminal-scope` | `-t` | Terminal monitoring scope | `current` | `--terminal-scope all` |
| `--delay` | `-d` | Response delay in seconds | `0.0` | `--delay 1.5` |
| `--timeout` | | Auto-stop timeout (minutes) | `30` | `--timeout 60` |
| `--whitelist` | | Enable tool whitelisting | `true` | `--whitelist` |
| `--no-whitelist` | | Disable tool whitelisting | | `--no-whitelist` |
| `--debug` | | Enable debug logging | `false` | `--debug` |

**Terminal Scope Options:**
- `current` - Monitor only current terminal window
- `all` - Monitor all terminal windows
- `project` - Monitor project-related terminals

**Examples:**
```bash

title: Basic start with default settings
text:
# Basic start with default settings
dopemux autoresponder start

section_path: Start with 1-second delay for scattered attention
title: Start with 1-second delay for scattered attention
text:
# Start with 1-second delay for scattered attention
dopemux autoresponder start --delay 1.0

section_path: Monitor all terminals with debug logging
title: Monitor all terminals with debug logging
text:
# Monitor all terminals with debug logging
dopemux autoresponder start -t all --debug

title: Extended session with 60-minute timeout
text:
# Extended session with 60-minute timeout
dopemux autoresponder start --timeout 60
```

**Sample Output:**
```
ğŸš€ Starting auto responder...
âœ… Claude Auto Responder is now active
ğŸ¯ Monitoring for Claude Code confirmation prompts
ğŸ“¡ Scope: current
ğŸ’¤ Auto-stop after 30 minutes of inactivity
```

title: `stop`
text:
##### `stop`
**Stop automatic confirmation monitoring**

```bash
dopemux autoresponder stop
```

Stops the autoresponder and displays session statistics.

**Sample Output:**
```
â¹ï¸ Stopping auto responder...
âœ… Claude Auto Responder stopped

ğŸ“Š Session Statistics:
  â±ï¸ Uptime: 45.3 minutes
  âœ… Responses sent: 23
  ğŸ“ˆ Rate: 0.51 responses/min
```

title: `status`
text:
##### `status`
**Show current autoresponder status and metrics**

```bash
dopemux autoresponder status
```

**Sample Output:**
```
ğŸ¤– Claude Auto Responder Status
â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”“
â”ƒ Property              â”‚ Value                                                           â”ƒ
â”¡â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”©
â”‚ Status                â”‚ ğŸŸ¢ Running                                                     â”‚
â”‚ Running               â”‚ Yes                                                             â”‚
â”‚ Uptime                â”‚ 15.2 minutes                                                   â”‚
â”‚ Responses Sent        â”‚ 8                                                               â”‚
â”‚ Response Rate         â”‚ 0.53/min                                                       â”‚
â”‚ Attention State       â”‚ focused                                                         â”‚
â”‚ Last Response         â”‚ 2024-01-15T14:30:45                                           â”‚
```

title: `config`
text:
##### `config`
**Configure autoresponder settings**

```bash
dopemux autoresponder config [OPTIONS]
```

**Options:**

| Option | Description | Values | Example |
|--------|-------------|--------|---------|
| `--enabled` | Enable autoresponder | | `--enabled` |
| `--disabled` | Disable autoresponder | | `--disabled` |
| `--terminal-scope` | Set monitoring scope | `current`, `all`, `project` | `--terminal-scope all` |
| `--delay` | Set response delay | `0.0` to `10.0` seconds | `--delay 2.0` |
| `--timeout` | Set timeout duration | Minutes | `--timeout 45` |
| `--whitelist` | Enable tool whitelisting | | `--whitelist` |
| `--no-whitelist` | Disable tool whitelisting | | `--no-whitelist` |
| `--debug` | Enable debug mode | | `--debug` |
| `--no-debug` | Disable debug mode | | `--no-debug` |

**Examples:**
```bash

title: Show current configuration
text:
# Show current configuration
dopemux autoresponder config

title: Enable with specific settings
text:
# Enable with specific settings
dopemux autoresponder config --enabled --delay 1.0 --terminal-scope all

section_path: Configure for hyperfocus sessions (no delay, extended timeout)
title: Configure for hyperfocus sessions (no delay, extended timeout)
text:
# Configure for hyperfocus sessions (no delay, extended timeout)
dopemux autoresponder config --delay 0.0 --timeout 90

title: Configure for scattered attention (with delays)
text:
# Configure for scattered attention (with delays)
dopemux autoresponder config --delay 2.0 --timeout 20
```

**Sample Configuration Update:**
```
âœ… Configuration updated
  enabled: True
  delay: 1.0
  terminal_scope: all
ğŸ”„ Restarting auto responder with new settings...
```

title: ADHD-Optimized Usage Patterns
text:
#### ADHD-Optimized Usage Patterns

**For Different Attention States:**

**ğŸ¯ Hyperfocus Sessions:**
```bash

section_path: No delays, extended timeout for deep work
title: No delays, extended timeout for deep work
text:
# No delays, extended timeout for deep work
dopemux autoresponder config --delay 0.0 --timeout 120
dopemux autoresponder start
```

**ğŸŒªï¸ Scattered Attention:**
```bash

title: Gentle delays to reduce overwhelm
text:
# Gentle delays to reduce overwhelm
dopemux autoresponder config --delay 1.5 --timeout 20
dopemux autoresponder start
```

**âš¡ Context Switching:**
```bash

title: Project-specific scope to avoid interference
text:
# Project-specific scope to avoid interference
dopemux autoresponder config --terminal-scope project
dopemux autoresponder start
```

**ğŸ”§ Development Setup:**
```bash

title: Safe defaults for coding sessions
text:
# Safe defaults for coding sessions
dopemux autoresponder config --enabled --whitelist --timeout 45
dopemux autoresponder start
```

title: Integration with Other Commands
text:
#### Integration with Other Commands

The autoresponder integrates seamlessly with other Dopemux commands:

```bash

title: Start complete development session
text:
# Start complete development session
dopemux start --with-autoresponder

title: Check status including autoresponder
text:
# Check status including autoresponder
dopemux status  # Shows autoresponder in overview

title: Save context with autoresponder metrics
text:
# Save context with autoresponder metrics
dopemux save -m "Completed with auto-responses: 15"
```

---

title: Error Handling
text: ## Error Handling

title: Common Errors and Solutions
text: ### Common Errors and Solutions

title: Project Not Initialized
text:
#### Project Not Initialized
```bash
Error: No Dopemux project found in current directory

Solution:
â€¢ Run 'dopemux init' to initialize current directory
â€¢ Navigate to existing Dopemux project
â€¢ Use 'dopemux init /path/to/project' for specific directory
```

title: Claude Code Not Found
text:
#### Claude Code Not Found
```bash
Error: Claude Code not found. Please install Claude Code first.

Solution:
â€¢ Install Claude Code from https://claude.ai/code
â€¢ Ensure claude-code is in your PATH
â€¢ Verify installation: claude-code --version
```

title: Session Restore Failed
text:
#### Session Restore Failed
```bash
Error: Session f7a3b2c8 not found

Solution:
â€¢ Use 'dopemux restore --list' to see available sessions
â€¢ Check session ID spelling (case-sensitive)
â€¢ Try 'dopemux restore' to restore latest session
```

title: Database Locked
text:
#### Database Locked
```bash
Error: Context database is locked by another process

Solution:
â€¢ Close other Dopemux instances
â€¢ Wait 30 seconds and try again
â€¢ Check for zombie processes: ps aux | grep dopemux
```

title: Permission Denied
text:
#### Permission Denied
```bash
Error: Permission denied writing to .dopemux/context.db

Solution:
â€¢ Check directory permissions: ls -la .dopemux/
â€¢ Ensure you own the project directory
â€¢ Try: chmod 755 .dopemux/ && chmod 644 .dopemux/*
```

title: Debug Mode
text:
### Debug Mode

Enable debug mode for detailed error information:

```bash
dopemux --verbose start --debug
```

Debug output includes:
- ğŸ“Š Performance timing for all operations
- ğŸ”§ MCP server configuration details
- ğŸ’¾ Database query execution times
- ğŸ§  Attention classification algorithm details
- ğŸ“ File system operation logging

---

title: Environment Variables
text: ## Environment Variables

title: Configuration Override
text:
### Configuration Override

| Variable | Description | Example |
|----------|-------------|---------|
| `DOPEMUX_CONFIG` | Override config file location | `export DOPEMUX_CONFIG=/custom/config.yaml` |
| `DOPEMUX_DEBUG` | Enable debug mode | `export DOPEMUX_DEBUG=1` |
| `DOPEMUX_CLAUDE_PATH` | Custom Claude Code path | `export DOPEMUX_CLAUDE_PATH=/usr/local/bin/claude-code` |

title: ADHD Profile Override
text:
### ADHD Profile Override

| Variable | Description | Example |
|----------|-------------|---------|
| `DOPEMUX_FOCUS_DURATION` | Override focus duration | `export DOPEMUX_FOCUS_DURATION=30` |
| `DOPEMUX_BREAK_INTERVAL` | Override break interval | `export DOPEMUX_BREAK_INTERVAL=10` |
| `DOPEMUX_AUTO_SAVE_INTERVAL` | Override auto-save interval | `export DOPEMUX_AUTO_SAVE_INTERVAL=15` |

title: MCP Server Configuration
text:
### MCP Server Configuration

| Variable | Description | Example |
|----------|-------------|---------|
| `DOPEMUX_MCP_CLAUDE_CONTEXT` | claude-context server path | `export DOPEMUX_MCP_CLAUDE_CONTEXT=/path/to/server` |
| `DOPEMUX_MCP_SEQUENTIAL_THINKING` | mas-sequential-thinking path | `export DOPEMUX_MCP_SEQUENTIAL_THINKING=/path/to/server` |

---

title: Shell Integration
text: ## Shell Integration

title: Bash/Zsh Completion
text:
### Bash/Zsh Completion

Add to your `.bashrc` or `.zshrc`:

```bash

title: Dopemux completion
text:
# Dopemux completion
eval "$(_DOPEMUX_COMPLETE=bash_source dopemux)"  # bash
eval "$(_DOPEMUX_COMPLETE=zsh_source dopemux)"   # zsh
```

title: Aliases and Functions
text:
### Aliases and Functions

```bash

title: Quick aliases
text:
# Quick aliases
alias ds='dopemux status'
alias dsa='dopemux save'
alias dre='dopemux restore'
alias dtl='dopemux task --list'

section_path: Smart function to save with timestamp message
title: Smart function to save with timestamp message

section_path: Function to restore specific session by partial ID
title: Function to restore specific session by partial ID
text:
# Function to restore specific session by partial ID
drs() {
    local partial_id="$1"
    local full_id=$(dopemux restore --list | grep "$partial_id" | head -1 | awk '{print $1}')
    if [[ -n "$full_id" ]]; then
        dopemux restore --session "$full_id"
    else
        echo "No session found matching: $partial_id"
        dopemux restore --list
    fi
}
```

section_path: Function to restore specific session by partial ID
title: Tips and Best Practices
text: ## Tips and Best Practices

section_path: Function to restore specific session by partial ID
title: ADHD-Optimized Workflows
text: ### ADHD-Optimized Workflows

section_path: Function to restore specific session by partial ID
title: Daily Start Routine
text:
#### Daily Start Routine
```bash

title: 1. Check status from yesterday
text:
# 1. Check status from yesterday
dopemux status

section_path: 2. Restore previous context or start fresh
title: 2. Restore previous context or start fresh
text:
# 2. Restore previous context or start fresh
dopemux start

title: 3. Review planned tasks
text:
# 3. Review planned tasks
dopemux task --list

title: 4. Begin focused work session
text:
# 4. Begin focused work session
```

title: Hyperfocus Management
text:
#### Hyperfocus Management
```bash

title: Save context before entering hyperfocus
text:
# Save context before entering hyperfocus
dopemux save -m "About to dive deep into complex refactoring"

section_path: Set up task chunking even for hyperfocus
title: Set up task chunking even for hyperfocus
text:
# Set up task chunking even for hyperfocus
dopemux task "Complex refactoring session" -d 90 -p high
```

section_path: Set up task chunking even for hyperfocus
title: Context Switch Recovery
text:
#### Context Switch Recovery
```bash

title: When interrupted, quickly save context
text:
# When interrupted, quickly save context
dopemux save -m "Interrupted for meeting"

section_path: After interruption, restore and check status
title: After interruption, restore and check status
text:
# After interruption, restore and check status
dopemux restore
dopemux status --attention
```

section_path: After interruption, restore and check status
title: End of Day Routine
text:
#### End of Day Routine
```bash

title: Save final context
text:
# Save final context
dopemux save -m "End of day - good stopping point"

title: Review accomplishments
text:
# Review accomplishments
dopemux task --list
dopemux status
```

title: Performance Tips
text: ### Performance Tips

title: Faster Context Operations
text:
#### Faster Context Operations
```bash

title: Use partial session IDs (first 6-8 characters)
text:
# Use partial session IDs (first 6-8 characters)
dopemux restore -s f7a3b2

title: Background saves for large projects
text:
# Background saves for large projects
dopemux save --force &
```

title: Reduce Cognitive Load
text:
#### Reduce Cognitive Load
```bash

section_path: Use focused status view when overwhelmed
title: Use focused status view when overwhelmed
text:
# Use focused status view when overwhelmed
dopemux status --attention

title: Simple task view when scattered
text:
# Simple task view when scattered
dopemux task --list | head -5
```

---

**ğŸ“š CLI Reference Summary:**

The Dopemux CLI provides 5 core commands designed for ADHD developers:
- âœ… `init` - Project setup with ADHD-optimized templates
- âœ… `start` - Context restoration and Claude Code launch
- âœ… `save` - Manual context preservation with notes
- âœ… `restore` - Session navigation and restoration
- âœ… `status` - Real-time ADHD metrics and progress
- âœ… `task` - 25-minute chunk task management

**All commands feature gentle UX, clear visual feedback, and <500ms performance for ADHD needs. ğŸ§ ğŸ’š**
